description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3d3vl","text":"This protocol describes the method of use for the Glucagon-Like Peptide-1 (Active) ELISA Kit\n96-Well Plate (Cat. # EGLP-35K) to measure GLP-1 release (pM) from supernatant. The assay should be run in duplicate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
disclaimer: {"blocks":[{"key":"2muuo","text":"This protocol was adapted from Cat. # EGLP-35K to optimise the seeding density of the assay based on the cell line used (Hutu 80 enteroendocrine cells RRID: CVCL_1301), moreover, cell line used and media conditions used to characterise GLP-1release. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9suts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pnt5","text":"The lowest level of GLP-1 that can be detected by this assay is 2 pM (100ul plasma sample size).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nqo2","text":"GLP-1 (Active) ELISA Plate

Substrate (Light sensitive, avoid unnecessary exposure to light)
Quantity: 10 mg
Preparation: Hydrate in 1 mL deionized water just before use. Use at 1:200 dilution in substrate diluent (e.g. 100 uL hydrated substrate in 20 mL substrate diluent). Dilute fresh each time just before use. protocol_references:
{"blocks":[{"key":"c2r6u","text":"Nathan DM, Schreiber E, Fogel H, Mojsov S, Hebener JF. Insulinotropic Action of Glucagon-like peptide-1 (7-37) in Diabetic and Nondiabetic Subjects. Diabetes Care 15: 270-276, 1992
Kieffer TJ, McIntosh CHS, Pederson RA. Degradation of Glucose-Dependent Insulinotropic Polypeptide (GIP) and Truncated Glucagon-Like Peptide (GLP-1) in vitro and in vivo by Dipeptidyl Peptidase IV. Endocrinology 136: 3585-3596, 1995
Tijsen P. “Practice and Theory of Enzyme Immunoassays” in Burdon RH and Knippenberg PH (Ed.), Laboratory Techniques in Biochemisrty and Molecular Biology. Amsterdam/NY: Elsevier, 1985
Christopoulos TK and Diamandis EP. “Fluorescence Immunoassays” in Diamandis EP and Christopoulos TK (Ed.), Immunoassay. Academic Press, 1996
Holst JJ, Cathrin Orskov, Bolette Hartmann, Carolyn F. Deacon : Postranslational processing of proglucagon and postsecretory fate of proglucagon products; in Fehmann HC, Goke B (eds) : The Insulinotropic Gut Hormone Glucagon-Like Peptide-1. Front Diabetes. Basel, Karger, 1997, vol 13, pp 24-48","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1svul","text":"Plate cells in sterile 24-well plates at 1.5x10^5 per well and leave   in a   incubator with stable CO2 conditions overnight. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":69,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":76,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"au3ks","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"65A59FA02C6B11EEB7D82D6C44F07185","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B44334102C6B11EEB7D82D6C44F07185","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4478r","text":"In a laminar flow hood aspirate medium and wash with PBS 3 times, adding   each time. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bb49t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"A7C447E02C6D11EEB7D82D6C44F07185","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aa49","text":"Once the final PBS wash is complete add in   of the test media made up for your desired experiment (e.g., high glucose media or 2-Deoxy-D-glucose) and place back in the incubator for   . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":183,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"agdup","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"500","error":false,"guid":"333D59202C6D11EEB7D82D6C44F07185","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"0AD124802C6D11EEB7D82D6C44F07185","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aqvot","text":"Once the plate has finished incubating, move over the   supernatant into a new sterile 24-well plate and add DPP-IV inhibitor immediately (1:100).to be carried out in a laminar flood hood.  The cells may be stored at   for further analysis at a later date.
